body:
Comment 1: 
Wrt "Giving the return variable a name should have absolutely no effect on the generated
assembly code.", I'm not that sure. Depends on specific implementation, but I can
imagine a setup where a named return variable is set to the respective zero value of its
type on function entry. This may legitimately change the situation for the register
allocator compared to when the compiler sees first "write" access of the same thing only
somewhere later, e.g. in a return statement.
